item.title: KKR 加入私募市场规模争夺战的五亿俱乐部
item.description: KKR & Co.成为第四家管理收费资产突破 5000 亿美元的私人市场公司，进一步超越其收购根基，努力争取更多的客户资产和更稳定的收费。【原文：KKR & Co. became the fourth private-markets firm to eclipse $500 billion of fee-paying assets under management, moving further beyond its buyout roots in a push for more client assets and steadier fees.】

item.title: 大选博彩网站 Polymarket 称特朗普 "鲸鱼 "被确认为法国商人
item.description: 经过基于加密货币的预测市场平台的调查，一名在 Polymarket 上花费超过 4500 万美元押注唐纳德-特朗普将赢得即将到来的美国总统大选的交易员已被确认为法国人。【原文：A trader who spent more than $45 million on Polymarket bets that Donald Trump will win the upcoming US presidential election has been identified as a French national, following an investigation by the cryptocurrency-based prediction markets platform.】

item.title: 纳格尔称欧洲央行不应仓促降息
item.description: 欧洲央行理事会成员约阿希姆-纳格尔（Joachim Nagel）认为，欧洲央行不应过于急于降低借贷成本，而应保持灵活性。【原文：The European Central Bank shouldn’t hurry too much to lower borrowing costs but remain flexible, according to Governing Council member Joachim Nagel.】

item.title: 选举结果公布前骚乱加剧，莫桑比克债券下跌
item.description: 莫桑比克 2031 年 9 月到期的美元债券连续第五天下跌，这是自 4 月以来最长的一次下挫，此前反对党领导人呼吁 "革命"，威胁要在周四公布选举结果时使政治动荡升级。【原文：Mozambique’s US dollar bonds due in September 2031 dropped for a fifth day, the longest selloff since April, after the opposition leader called for a “revolution,” threatening to escalate political unrest as election results are released Thursday.】

item.title: 德国经济下滑，到 2028 年税收收入将减少 126 亿欧元
item.description: 由于欧洲最大的经济体在努力增长，德国联邦政府预计到 2028 年的五年内税收收入将比 5 月份估计的少 126 亿欧元（136 亿美元）。【原文：The German federal government expects €12.6 billion ($13.6 billion) less in tax revenue in the five years through 2028 than estimated in May as Europe’s biggest economy struggles to grow.】

item.title: 加密货币交易所 Kraken 计划明年初推出自己的区块链
item.description: 世界上历史最悠久的加密货币交易所之一 Kraken 计划明年初推出区块链，用于去中心化应用，允许在没有中介的情况下进行代币交易、借贷。【原文：One of world’s oldest crypto exchanges, Kraken, plans to launch a blockchain early next year for decentralized applications that allow for trading, borrowing and lending of tokens without intermediaries.】

item.title: 埃尼确认 20 亿欧元重塑意大利化工部门计划
item.description: 埃尼集团（Eni SpA）计划在五年内投资约 20 亿欧元（22 亿美元），重新启动其在意大利的老化化学品业务【原文：Eni SpA plans to invest about €2 billion ($2.2 billion) over five years to relaunch its aging chemicals business in Italy】

item.title: 安哥拉称正在研究国际货币基金组织贷款计划方案
item.description: 安哥拉财政部长Vera Daves de Sousa说，安哥拉政府正与国际货币基金组织就一个可能的新项目举行会谈，并正在评估哪种类型的贷款更适合这个产油国的需要。【原文：Angola’s government is holding talks with the International Monetary Fund about a possible new program and is evaluating what type of loan would better fit the oil-producing country’s needs, Finance Minister Vera Daves de Sousa said.】

item.title: 英特尔支持的区块链初创公司 R3 权衡包括出售在内的各种选择
item.description: R3是一家区块链公司，得到了包括美国银行（Bank of America Corp）和英特尔公司（Intel Corp）在内的投资者的支持，熟悉此事的人士称，该公司正在探索包括出售自身在内的战略选择。【原文：R3, a blockchain company backed by investors including Bank of America Corp. and Intel Corp., is exploring strategic options including selling itself, people familiar with the matter said.】

item.title: 欧洲央行行长卡扎克称利率问题上有各种选择：CNBC
item.description: 欧洲中央银行管理委员会成员马丁斯-卡扎克斯（Martins Kazaks）表示，官员们将在接下来的会议上考虑一系列选择方案，其中包括按兵不动和更大幅度地降息。【原文：European Central Bank Governing Council member Martins Kazaks said officials will consider a range of options in the coming meetings — including standing pat and cutting interest rates in bigger steps.】

item.title: 对华尔街而言，Palantir 在人工智能推动下的涨势太过迅猛了
item.description: 在经历了近 150% 的涨幅，市值增加了约 600 亿美元之后，华尔街认为 Palantir Technologies Inc.【原文：After an almost 150% rally that’s added about $60 billion in market value, Wall Street thinks Palantir Technologies Inc. has gotten way ahead of itself.】

item.title: 如果消费者不掏钱，欧洲的能源转型就不会实现
item.description:
政府需要提供正确的政策框架，但这最终意味着所有人都要支付更高的费用。【原文：

Governments need to provide the right policy framework, but that ultimately means higher bills for all.

】

item.title: 欧洲首笔由太阳能电池板支持的债券交易即将上市
item.description: 欧洲公共债务市场将首次出售由太阳能电池板贷款支持的债券。【原文：Europe’s public debt market is set to get its first sale of a bond backed by solar-panel loans.】

item.title: Tether 要求土耳其考虑为硼酸盐矿产发行数字代币
item.description: Tether Holdings Ltd.试图说服土耳其使用数字资产来整顿该国的硼市场，这是加密货币行业的关键人物利用大宗商品领域实现进一步增长的最新迹象。【原文：Tether Holdings Ltd. sought to convince Turkey to use digital assets to overhaul the nation’s boron market, the latest sign of the crypto industry linchpin tapping the commodity sector for further growth.】

item.title: 罗杰斯与不愿透露姓名的投资者达成 51 亿美元融资协议
item.description: 加拿大最大的无线公司罗杰斯通信公司（Rogers Communications Inc.【原文：Rogers Communications Inc., Canada’s largest wireless company, says it’s close to a C$7 billion ($5.1 billion) structured equity investment to finance parts of its network and reduce its debt load.】

item.title: 谷歌的人工智能投资获得英国正式合并调查
item.description: 谷歌与人工智能公司 Anthropic 的合作在英国面临脱轨的风险，因为竞争监督机构要求进一步调查该协议的潜在影响。【原文：Google’s partnership with AI firm Anthropic is at risk of being derailed in the UK after the competition watchdog called for further investigation of the pact’s potential impact.】

item.title: 对特朗普的恐惧使新兴市场股市走向一月以来最糟糕的一个月
item.description: 新兴市场股市创下了自美联储上月降息前以来最长的连跌纪录，原因是对美国总统大选的紧张情绪和对中国经济刺激措施的失望促使投资者远离风险资产。【原文：Emerging-market stocks headed for the longest losing streak since before the Federal Reserve’s interest-rate cut last month as nervousness around the US presidential election and disappointment over China’s stimulus efforts pushed investors away from riskier assets.】

item.title: 马斯克的 "星链 "终端在津巴布韦首都售罄，需求激增
item.description: 埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）的 "星链"（Starlink）终端在津巴布韦首都哈拉雷售罄，而这距离他获得当局允许在这个南部非洲国家运营还不到两个月。【原文：Elon Musk’s Starlink terminals sold out in Zimbabwe’s capital of Harare, less than two months after receiving permission from authorities to operate in the southern African nation.】

item.title: 埃隆-马斯克现在是 X 反移民阴谋的最大鼓吹者。
item.description:
这位亿万富翁的老板正在散布无证选民左右美国大选的谬论，并在此过程中扩大自己的社会影响力

。【原文：

The billionaire owner is spreading debunked theories of undocumented voters swaying the US election, and growing his social influence in the process

】

item.title: 特朗普和马斯克的错误信息让曙光之城对移民不安全
item.description: 你好，我是旧金山的朱莉娅。我访问了科罗拉多州的奥罗拉市，以了解移民是如何在这个已成为唐纳德-特朗普和埃隆-马斯克严厉移民言论目标的社区找到立足之地的。但首先...【原文：Hi, it’s Julia in San Francisco. I visited Aurora, Colorado, to understand how migrants are trying to find a foothold in a community that has become a target of Donald Trump and Elon Musk’s harsh immigration rhetoric. But first...】

item.title: 银行家不惜一切代价从罕见的收购交易中分一杯羹
item.description:
CD&R在莫里森超市的不愉快经历并没有阻止投资银行家们成群结队地排队，希望从赛诺菲消费药物分公司的债务融资交易中分一杯羹。【原文：

CD&R’s unhappy Morrisons experience hasn’t stopped investment bankers from lining up in droves to get a piece of its debt-financing deal for Sanofi’s consumer drug offshoot. 

】

item.title: Absa 发现非洲市场以 2017 年以来最快速度扩张
item.description: 随着非洲大陆受益于经济增长复苏和通胀放缓，非洲金融市场正以七年来最快的速度扩张。【原文：Africa’s financial markets are expanding at the fastest pace in seven years, as the continent benefits from a recovery in economic growth and slowing inflation.】

item.title: 住宅建筑业困境促使哥伦比亚破产率创十年新高
item.description: 哥伦比亚今年申请破产的公司数量有望达到十年来的最高水平，这给总统古斯塔沃-佩特罗（Gustavo Petro）带来了压力，迫使他带领哥伦比亚走出经济低谷。【原文：The number of companies in Colombia filing for insolvency this year is on track to reach its highest level in a decade, heaping pressure on President Gustavo Petro to pull the country out of its economic doldrums.】

item.title: KKR 盈利激增 58%，资本市场部门表现强劲
item.description: KKR & Co. 公布的第三季度利润超过了华尔街的预期，原因是这家另类资产管理公司的资本市场业务交易费创下了历史新高。【原文：KKR & Co. reported a third-quarter profit that beat Wall Street estimates as the alternative asset manager generated record transaction fees for its capital markets business.】

item.title: 贝莱德的博文称美国大选争议是定价过低的风险
item.description: 贝莱德投资研究所（BlackRock Investment Institute）的让-博文（Jean Boivin）表示，市场低估了美国总统候选人之一对下月大选结果提出异议的风险。【原文：Markets are underpricing the risk that one of the US presidential candidates contests the results of next month’s election, according to the BlackRock Investment Institute’s Jean Boivin.】

item.title: 大选焦虑正在债券市场蔓延
item.description: 共和党大选的可能性及其对市场的影响已成为本周最大的主题之一。【原文：The possibility of a Republican sweep and what that would mean for markets has emerged as one of the biggest themes this week.】

item.title: 美国国债反弹，市场摆脱连日跌势
item.description: 周四，国债的大幅下挫有所缓解，美国债券在连续三天下跌后表现优于全球同类债券。【原文：The sharp selloff in Treasuries abated on Thursday, with US bonds outperforming global peers after three straight days of declines.】

item.title: 泰晤士河水务公司的次级债权人准备贷款超过 15 亿英镑
item.description: 一个持有泰晤士河水务公司最高风险债务的债权人团体正在制定计划，为这家陷入困境的英国公用事业公司提供至少 15 亿英镑（19 亿美元）的贷款，以帮助其避免破产。【原文：A group of creditors that holds Thames Water’s riskiest debt is drawing up plans to provide the beleaguered UK utility with a loan of at least £1.5 billion ($1.9 billion) to help it stave off insolvency.】

item.title: LinkedIn 因非法数据行为在欧盟被罚 3.1 亿欧元
item.description: 爱尔兰数据保护委员会对 LinkedIn 爱尔兰公司处以 3.1 亿欧元（约合 3.35 亿美元）的罚款，原因是该公司非法处理欧盟境内用户的个人数据以发布定向广告。【原文：Ireland’s data protection commission has fined LinkedIn Ireland €310 million ($335 million) for illegally processing the personal data of users within the European Union to deliver targeted advertising.】

item.title: 高盛和法国巴黎银行看到信贷的全面反弹变成了 "挑肥拣瘦
item.description: 全球信贷市场水涨船高的时代可能已经结束。【原文：The era of a rising tide lifting all boats in the global credit market may be over.】
